The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)

We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on hearty, comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked with fresh herbs and served with crackers. 
1.2) Spicy Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in a zesty mixture of lime juice and spices. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast: Chicken breast seared to perfection and served with a side of roasted vegetables. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes roasted with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. 
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Blanched green beans sautéed with sliced almonds and a hint of lemon. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Cheesecake: A classic cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a berry compote. 
4.2) Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in rich, dark chocolate. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich, creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing glass of iced tea infused with lemon and mint.

#*# Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on international flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with shrimp and vegetables, served with a sweet chili sauce. 
1.2) Grilled Halloumi: A Cypriot cheese grilled to perfection and served with a side of honey and thyme. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Chicken marinated in spices and yogurt, grilled and served in a rich tomato sauce. 
2.2) Beef Wellington: Tender beef wrapped in puff pastry and baked to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice cooked to perfection. 
3.2) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus roasted with olive oil and parmesan cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern dessert made with layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Tres Leches Cake: A moist sponge cake soaked in three types of milk (evaporated milk, condensed milk, and heavy cream). 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing yogurt-based drink infused with mango puree. 
5.2) Turkish Coffee: A strong, rich coffee made with finely ground coffee beans and served in a small cup.

#*# Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We continue to explore international flavors with a focus on Asian cuisine. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Edamame Dumplings: Steamed dumplings filled with edamame and served with a side of soy sauce. 
1.2) Grilled Pork Skewers: Marinated pork skewers grilled to perfection and served with a side of peanut sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Kung Pao Chicken: Stir-fried chicken cooked with peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers in a savory sauce. 
2.2) Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry: A classic Chinese dish made with beef, broccoli, and a savory sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Fried Wontons: Crispy fried wontons served with a side of sweet chili sauce. 
3.2) Steamed Bok Choy: Fresh bok choy steamed to perfection and served with a side of soy sauce. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: A classic Thai dessert made with sweet sticky rice, mango, and coconut milk. 
4.2) Coconut Ice Cream: A refreshing coconut ice cream served with a side of toasted coconut flakes. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Green Tea: A soothing green tea infused with jasmine and served hot or iced. 
5.2) Lychee Martini: A sweet and tangy martini made with lychee liqueur and served chilled.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on seasonal ingredients and bold flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: Fresh heirloom tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella, dressed with a balsamic vinaigrette. 
1.2) Pan-Seared Scallops: Scallops seared to perfection, served with a citrus-herb sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Filet Mignon: Tender filet mignon grilled to perfection, served with a rich demiglace. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Cod: Cod fillet pan-seared, served with a lemon-dill sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Fresh asparagus roasted to perfection, finished with a drizzle of olive oil. 
3.2) Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with garlic and herbs, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Creme Brûlée: A rich lemon-lavender custard base topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 
4.2) Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in rich dark chocolate, perfect for a sweet treat. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the bold flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Fresh Juices: A variety of fresh juices, including orange, grapefruit, and cranberry, to cleanse the palate.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on hearty, comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked with fresh herbs and served with crackers. 
1.2) Mini Quiches: Bite-sized quiches filled with ham, cheese, and vegetables. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet seared to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted to bring out their natural sweetness. 
3.2) Creamy Polenta: Smooth polenta infused with parmesan cheese and herbs. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Warm Apple Crisp: A classic dessert featuring tender apples topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping. 
4.2) Vanilla Panna Cotta: Creamy vanilla panna cotta topped with a mixed berry compote. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: Rich, velvety hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 
5.2) Iced Tea: Refreshing iced tea infused with fruits and herbs.

#*# Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We welcome the third week of the year with a focus on international flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Halloumi: Cypriot cheese grilled to perfection and served with a side of honey and thyme. 
1.2) Steamed Edamame: Japanese-style steamed edamame served with a dipping sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Shawarma: Juicy chicken breast marinated in Middle Eastern spices and served in a pita with tzatziki sauce. 
2.2) Korean-Style BBQ Beef: Thinly sliced beef short ribs marinated in a sweet and spicy Korean-inspired sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice cooked to perfection. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and lemon. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: Classic Middle Eastern pastry made with layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Mochi Ice Cream: Japanese-style ice cream sandwiched between soft mochi dough. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Turkish Coffee: Strong, rich coffee made with finely ground coffee beans. 
5.2) Mango Lassi: Refreshing yogurt-based drink infused with mango puree and spices.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.2 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.3 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-20 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 11-30 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 2 to Week 5 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Taco Tuesdays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Assorted Tacos.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on fresh flavors and vibrant colors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: Fresh heirloom tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella cheese, dressed with a zesty balsamic vinaigrette. 
1.2) Grilled Octopus: Char-grilled octopus served with a side of tangy aioli. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet cooked to perfection, served with a citrus-herb butter. 
2.2) Grilled Lamb Chops: Tender lamb chops marinated in a mixture of olive oil, garlic, and rosemary, grilled to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Fresh asparagus roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
3.2) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice cooked with chicken broth and a hint of lemon. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Panna Cotta: A creamy panna cotta infused with the sweetness of lavender and the brightness of lemon. 
4.2) Fresh Fruit Tart: A sweet and tangy mix of fresh fruits atop a buttery pastry crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fresh Juices: A selection of freshly squeezed juices, including orange, grapefruit, and pineapple. 
5.2) Herbal Teas: A soothing blend of herbal teas, such as chamomile and peppermint, to complement the meal.

#*# Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We welcome the third week of the year with a focus on comfort food and hearty flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Leek Soup: A rich and creamy soup made with leeks, potatoes, and a hint of nutmeg. 
1.2) Crispy Fried Calamari: Crispy fried squid rings served with a side of tangy marinara sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast: Fresh chicken breast cooked to perfection, served with a side of creamy mushroom sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic and Rosemary Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes infused with the flavors of garlic and rosemary. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Fresh Brussels sprouts roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Warm Apple Crisp: A classic dessert featuring tender apples topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping. 
4.2) Chocolate Lava Cake: A rich and decadent chocolate cake oozing with warm chocolate sauce. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Beers: A selection of craft beers, including IPAs, stouts, and pale ales. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on hearty, comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Baked Brie and Fresh Fruit: A wheel of brie cheese baked until golden, served with a selection of fresh fruits. 
1.2) Mini Crab Cakes: Crispy crab cakes filled with jumbo lump crab meat, served with a tangy remoulade sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich, full-bodied red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet seared to perfection, served with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted to perfection, tossed with fresh herbs. 
3.2) Creamy Polenta: Smooth polenta infused with roasted garlic and parmesan cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Warm Apple Crisp: A classic dessert featuring tender apples topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping. 
4.2) Lemon Lavender Panna Cotta: A creamy panna cotta infused with the sweetness of lavender and the brightness of lemon. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the comforting flavors of the meal. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: Rich, velvety hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and chocolate shavings. 
This week's menu continues the celebration of the New Year with dishes that warm the heart and soul.

#*# Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We welcome the midpoint of January with a menu that highlights the beauty of winter ingredients. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: A colorful salad featuring heirloom tomatoes, creamy burrata cheese, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze. 
1.2) Roasted Beet Tartlets: Mini puff pastry tartlets filled with roasted beets, goat cheese, and fresh thyme. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops: Fresh scallops seared to perfection, served with a citrus-herb sauce and microgreens. 
2.2) Braised Beef Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich, full-bodied red wine sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach quickly sautéed with garlic and lemon, served with a sprinkle of red pepper flakes. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Crispy Brussels sprouts roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Soufflé: A rich, decadent chocolate soufflé served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
4.2) Lemon Lavender Creme Brûlée: A creamy lemon and lavender-infused custard base topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of white and red wines to pair with the winter ingredients. 
5.2) Hot Cider: A warm, spiced apple cider to cozy up with. 
This week's menu showcases the best of winter's bounty, with dishes that highlight the season's freshest flavors.

#*# Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We celebrate the midpoint of the month with a menu that honors the rich flavors of the Mediterranean. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Octopus: Char-grilled octopus served with a zesty lemon-herb sauce and a side of crispy crostini. 
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A classic dip featuring spinach, artichoke hearts, and a blend of creamy cheeses, served with crudités and pita chips. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops: Tender lamb chops marinated in a mixture of olive oil, lemon juice, and herbs, grilled to perfection. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Sea Bass: Fresh sea bass seared to a golden crust, served with a side of garlic and lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Lemon Potatoes: Thinly sliced potatoes roasted with lemon zest, olive oil, and fresh rosemary. 
3.2) Grilled Asparagus: Fresh asparagus grilled to perfection, served with a dollop of tzatziki sauce. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A classic Greek dessert featuring layers of phyllo dough, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Lemon Panna Cotta: A creamy panna cotta infused with the brightness of lemon zest and a touch of honey. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Ouzo Spritz: A refreshing cocktail featuring ouzo, lemon-lime soda, and a splash of grenadine. 
5.2) Greek Coffee: A strong, rich coffee served in a traditional Greek coffee cup. 
This week's menu takes us on a culinary journey through the Mediterranean, with dishes that celebrate the bold flavors and aromas of the region.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

#*# Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on hearty, comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked with fresh herbs and served with crackers. 
1.2) Mini Quiches: Bite-sized quiches filled with ham, cheese, and vegetables. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet seared to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted to bring out their natural sweetness. 
3.2) Creamy Polenta: Smooth polenta infused with parmesan cheese and herbs. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Cheesecake: A classic cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a berry compote. 
4.2) Chocolate Soufflé: A rich, decadent chocolate soufflé served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich, creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing iced tea infused with fruits and herbs.

2.1) Chicken Cacciatore: Chicken breast cooked with onions, bell peppers, and mushrooms in a rich tomato sauce. 
2.2) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French dish made with slow-cooked beef, mushrooms, and red wine. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with garlic, herbs, and parmesan cheese.

response:
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.
